text: we're on our very first night dive but
we're not in the ocean we're in the
middle of the desert meet Kathy and Joel
they're the crazy owners of this little
dive shop in the desert they specialize
in unique dives in and around Lake
Havasu and what could we possibly see in
the lake at night we get geared up and
Jason learns the golden rule of night
dives don't fly in the dive master and
underwater you can do these things once
the moon is up and all is dark we are
off now if I can just remember how all
this gear works yep
welcome to Lake Havasu City this is a
night day what's cool about a night dive
is you're focused in an only the area
that your light illuminates it's such a
narrow field of view when I first turned
around and saw nothing but black it kind
of freaked me out it's like entering a
black hole I know my fin touched
something just as I swam away and it
took me a second to realize it was just
the ship you forget for a second it's so
safe in here no sharks jellies or
piranhas to worry about
once you relax it's like rummaging
around an old antique store it's dark
it's damp and things seem almost
suspended
a bit like being in space my first night
dive sweet
you
